Description: North American Pipe Corporation (NAPCO) agreed to settle allegations that the company supplied the government untested polyvinyl chloride pipe. NAPCO, a subsidiary of Westlake Chemical Company, agreed tol pay $500,000 to settle claims that the company sold the untested pipe to the Defense Department and the Federal Bureau of Prisons.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/opa/pr/2000/June/343civ.htm

Description: Eagle US 2 agreed to pay $400,000 to the state and pay $220,000 towards beneficial environmental projects in settlement of allegations it exceeded air pollution limits multiple times and did not follow pollution control requirements at its Lake Charles Manufacturing Complex. The facility had been bought from PPG Industries, and they are noted as the responsible company in the initial Order, but the settlement is with Eagle US 2.
Info Source: https://deq.louisiana.gov/assets/docs/General/Settlement_Agreements/2013/PPGIndustries_Final.pdf
